definitions: in a way that creates a wide piece of something

examples.text: the meat was too thickly cut and impossible to chew

shortDefinitions: in way that creates wide piece of something

definitions: in a way that covers or fills something with a deep layer

examples.text: the paint has been applied thickly
a field thickly coated with snow

shortDefinitions: in way that covers or fills something with thick layer

definitions: in a closely compacted or crowded manner
shortDefinitions: in closely compacted or crowded manner

examples.text: "Isn't he a politician?" I say rather thickly

definitions: with a hoarse or husky voice; indistinctly

examples.text: "You woke me up," he said thickly

definitions: (with reference to an accent) in a way that is very marked and difficult to understand

examples.text: the actors speak in thickly accented English

shortDefinitions: in way that is very marked and difficult to understand
